“Thank you. But will I bother the sick guy with my presence?” Pyotr Petrovitch asked Zossimov. 

“N-no,” Zossimov mumbled. “You can keep him entertained.” He yawned again. 

“He’s been awake for a while, since morning,” Razumihin added, sounding friendly. Pyotr Petrovitch brightened up a bit, probably because this scruffy student didn’t seem to care about appearances.

“Your mom…” Luzhin started.

“Uh-huh!” Razumihin interrupted, clearing his throat loudly. Luzhin looked at him, confused.

“Just keep going,” Razumihin urged.

Luzhin shrugged. “Your mom started a letter to you while I was nearby. I waited a few days to visit, just to make sure you were fully updated. But now, to my surprise…”

“I know, I know!” Raskolnikov snapped, clearly annoyed. “So you’re the fiancé? I get it, that’s enough!” 

Pyotr Petrovitch definitely looked offended this time, but he stayed quiet, trying hard to figure out what was happening. There was a brief silence.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses impatience upon realizing that Pyotr Petrovitch is his mother's fiancé.
